video.title: Interview Tips from a Senior Software Engineer... and a 4 year old
video.description:
Learn what Jesse did to prepare for interviews that let to four job offers and moving on the the final round of interviews with Google!

⭐️Resources ⭐️
⌨️Pramp: https://www.pramp.com/invt/39P8m2n2OgInqXYmMAKl&event=video_description (affiliate link for Jesse)
⌨️Cracking the Coding Interview: https://www.amazon.com/Cracking-Coding-Interview-Programming-Questions/dp/0984782850/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1543791520&sr=8-2&keywords=cracking+the+coding+interview
⌨️Data Structures and Algorithms with JavaScript: Bringing classic computing approaches to the Web by Michael McMillan
⌨️https://freeCodeCamp.org

You can see Jesse live coding on our channel or check out his personal channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUGkNhK8IEUj8A0vbyJ1Bzw

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: Artimus
topLevelComment.text: Kid is not distracting at all. I got into coding because I want to give my daughter a better life. She was 4 at the time I started. I’m currently hunting for a software dev job so I’ll use your tips and resources. Great vid. 👍🏼

topLevelComment.author: Vimlesh Kumar Kanaujiya
topLevelComment.text: Your kid is an intergiver, and you are talking about interviewer.

topLevelComment.author: siva balan
topLevelComment.text: Home alone hero is here

topLevelComment.text: I loved this! Thanks dude!

topLevelComment.author: Luxcium
topLevelComment.text: Should I bring my kid to the interview... :-P this is the cutest video I have seen haha it's a bit distracting but nowadays because everyone working home and kids don't go to school it's so much 2020 haha :-P

topLevelComment.author: Florestan Korp
topLevelComment.text: Having the kid there somehow calms me down. Sometimes I get too wrapped up in professionalism, and this gives me a good feeling of how naturally life can integrate with work. I say keep him in your videos

topLevelComment.author: Rushikesh ganesh
topLevelComment.text: What exactly expect in resume applying for google

replies.author: Jesse Weigel
replies.text: @Rushikesh ganesh code every day and keep trying new things. I try to use at least one new technique or technology for each project.

replies.author: Rushikesh ganesh
replies.text: Thanks for replying I m fresher I Working in small development farm how to upgrade our development skills

replies.author: Jesse Weigel
replies.text: I am not sure what is good to put in a resume for Google. In my case a recruiter contacted me directly without seeing my resume.
